data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in Antitrust Case
data.Description: A federal judge has ruled that Google is a monopolist, a significant victory for the Department of Justice in its antitrust case against the tech giant.

data.Title: Google's Crawling Practices Spark Discussion and Debate
data.Description: Google's statements about its crawling practices, including the use of URL parameters and the concept of crawl budget, have generated discussion and debate among SEO professionals.

data.Title: Google Search Updates and Features
data.Description: Google continues to roll out new features and updates to its search engine, including changes to featured snippets, Google Lens, and Search Console.

data.Title: Bing Tests New Search Results Page Behavior
data.Description: Microsoft Bing is experimenting with opening search results in a new window when users click on results from the home page search box or pagination bar.

data.Title: Google's Hidden Gems Update Boosts Forum Visibility
data.Description: Google's recent "hidden gems" update has led to a surge in visibility for online forums, including Reddit, Quora, and many others.

data.Title: Substack Opens Up Publishing to All Users
data.Description: Substack now allows anyone with an account to publish posts on the platform, even if they don't have a newsletter.

data.Title: Amazon to Use AI for Product Description Compliance
data.Description: Amazon will leverage AI to rewrite product descriptions that don't adhere to its guidelines, raising concerns among sellers.

data.Title: Apple Retains Google as Default Search Engine in Safari
data.Description: Despite a lucrative offer from Microsoft, Apple has chosen to keep Google as the default search engine in Safari, prioritizing user experience over potential financial gains.

data.Title: Elon Musk Sues GARM, Exposing Industry Rifts
data.Description: Elon Musk's lawsuit against the Global Alliance for Responsible Media (GARM) has revealed deep divisions and anxieties within the advertising industry regarding responsible media practices and brand safety.

data.Title: Backlink Selling Websites See Traffic Decline Despite Prevalence
data.Description: A new study reveals that websites selling backlinks are experiencing a decline in traffic, despite the practice being widespread and often suspected by SEO professionals.
